body:
Comment 3: 
> ... I'd like to know how to deal with the error.

The error returned on windows is whatever Windows API DnsQuery returns. Go stdlib just
passing the message.

> ... Am I supposed to use a regular expression to figure out what sort of error
occurred? ...

Can you explain what do you mean by "sort of error". I am not sure that all possible
errors here can be enumerated and categorized here. And why would you? How will it help
you in your user program?

> ... Also, there is no good reason for this to be inconsistent.  If the issue is that
it just hasn't been made consistent, that's fine, but that doesn't mean that it should
stay that way.  If there is a different reason, it'd be nice to see that reason
explained.

If you are talking about net.DNSError on Unix and os.SyscallError on Windows, then, I
think, no one though about it until now. Ii just happend to be that way. And I don't see
why it is important for these to be the same.

Alex
